title: BIOL 322 Lab 1.  Building Population Growth Models in Vensim PLE
text: initial lab exercise, introduce modeling software program Vensim PLE. starting exercise, download install free version Vensim PLE may access program via machines SCTR A262 computer lab. Thus, nothing special equations use , chosen fit observed data reasonably well. models, assume individuals added population result births removed population result deaths. ignore immigration emigration today’s models. Population size number individuals population. ’s variable want recalculate generation, accounting births deaths record output. Usually, ’re going expect change time. ’ll need set starting value check, every generation, see changed. Birth rate many organisms born organism already present population time step (per capita birth rate). variable can increase population size. value 1.0 means every individual population gives birth one new individual every generation. Note ’ll imagine models counting females organism able clone . Death rate variable can decrease population size (due natural mortality individuals). fraction population dies generation. , value 0.5 means half population willl die generation. Note logically variable must value 0 1. Flow equation calculating change population size time step. take information population size, birth rate, death rate, determine many individuals population next time step. think anything else important regulating population size, ’ll variables/ components relating factors . first population growth model ’ll create exponential growth model. model resources unlimited resource-based cap many individuals can survive. graphically represent growth model? Well, ’re going use stock--flow model, stocks ‘boxes’ can count stuff us flows contain equations update value stocks based parameters specify (like birth death rate). model, population size stock equation calculating change population size flow. stock flow connected flow can change value stock timestep. actually construct model, let’s look little closer math ’ll thinking create model. consider population organisms, newborn organisms arrive due births organisms depart due deaths. VensimPLE, can represent births flow deaths flow . , can use single bidirectional flow, overall direction flow (increasing decreasing stock’s value) net result birth rate minus death rate (b − d). Thus, growth rate r = b − d, intrinsic rate increase. Note r usually represents maximum rate growth. model size population time based rate birth (b), rate death (d), current value N (population size). Right now, ’re worrying genetics-—assuming everyone genotype—-aren’t tracking different genotypes, just counting number total individuals. , population size time zero, N0, want know population size one time step, N1 (one generation), going use exponential growth equation: dN / dt = rNt two-flows model, remember ’ll separate calculation birth one death two different flows. single flow version, ’ll flow growth contain equation N*(b-d). Next, going build model population growth resources limited renewable — logistic growth model. logistic growth models, assume renewable resources available environment can support many individuals thus rate growth varies depending density population, slowing population approaches carrying capacity. carrying capacity rate growth zero since individuals can supported. equation logistic growth : dN/dt = ΔN = rNt(1 - Nt/K) model includes parameter K, carrying capacity population. model, usually use r represent maximum rate growth don’t separate effects births deaths. can think r(1 − Nt/K) actual rate growth, given population K density. group, go ahead try build model (see image ). Note: use equations exponential growth model building logistic model. However, can use r instead separate values b d. set model, similar parameters exponential model also carrying capacity (K). Let’s use K = 200, r = 0.3, set initial N 10 like earlier. Click Simulation Control first horizontal icon bar. box pop ’ll save changes make. popup box, change run name r0p3 (can’t use decimals run name) Comment box type ‘r = 0.3’, default run don’t change value r. can click r confirm set 0.3. Click Save Changes click Simulate. Now want create new simulation r = 1.0. Click Simulation Control time change run name r1p0 Comments type ‘r = 1.0’. Click variable r change value 1. click Save Changes Simulate. Repeat steps appropriate alterations create simulations r = 2, r = 2.5, r = 2.7. created variations, click Simulate horizontal menu bar, click N, click Graph. graph appear line value r tested. can unclick legend declutter graph figure ’s going . Start just r = 0.3 add higher values one time. happens? might explain ’s going ? Thus, nothing special equations use , chosen fit observed data reasonably well. models, assume individuals added population result births removed population result deaths. ignore immigration emigration today’s models. Since know want portray (growth population starting number, result births allowing deaths), need think variables model happen variables time. Population size number individuals population. ’s variable want recalculate generation, accounting births deaths record output. Usually, ’re going expect change time. ’ll need set starting value check, every generation, see changed. Birth rate many organisms born organism already present population time step (per capita birth rate). variable can increase population size. value 1.0 means every individual population gives birth one new individual every generation. Death rate variable can decrease population size (due natural mortality individuals). fraction population dies generation. , value 0.5 means half population willl die generation. title: BIOL 322 Lab 1.  Building Population Growth Models in Vensim PLE
text: Next, going build model population growth resources limited renewable — logistic growth model. logistic growth models, assume renewable resources available environment can support many individuals thus rate growth varies depending density population, slowing population approaches carrying capacity. carrying capacity rate growth zero since individuals can supported. equation logistic growth : dN/dt = ΔN = rNt(1 - Nt/K) model includes parameter K, carrying capacity population. model, usually use r represent maximum rate growth don’t separate effects births deaths. can think r(1 − Nt/K) actual rate growth, given population K density. group, go ahead try build model (see image ). Note: use equations exponential growth model building logistic model. However, can use r instead separate values b d. set model, similar parameters exponential model also carrying capacity (K). Let’s use K = 200, r = 0.3, set initial N 10 like earlier. Click Simulation Control first horizontal icon bar. box pop ’ll save changes make. popup box, change run name r0p3 (can’t use decimals run name) Comment box type ‘r = 0.3’, default run don’t change value r. can click r confirm set 0.3. Click Save Changes click Simulate. Now want create new simulation r = 1.0. Click Simulation Control time change run name r1p0 Comments type ‘r = 1.0’. Click variable r change value 1. click Save Changes Simulate. Repeat steps appropriate alterations create simulations r = 2, r = 2.5, r = 2.7. created variations, click Simulate horizontal menu bar, click N, click Graph. graph appear line value r tested. can unclick legend declutter graph figure ’s going . title: BIOL 322 - Genetics of Populations
text: evolution phenotypic traits results action selective non-selective forces distribution genetic variation within among populations. use mathematical computational models study adaptation genetic architecture complex traits context natural populations. evolutionary approaches critical applications study disease, conservation biology, agriculture, response climate change. Labs computer-based focused modeling. Prerequisites: BIOL 200 210/211. Attributes: 4NS, QFR.

title: BIOL 322 - Genetics of Populations
text: Students completing course : Gain knowledge appreciation topics evolutionary genetics. Learn develop evaluate computational evolutionary models. Practice reading understanding scientific literature. Improve scientific writing oral communication skills. Gain deeper understanding critical thinking applied evolutionary genetics. Practice carrying open-ended, investigative research projects.
